Documentation has been fully automated 🎉 details below:

 

  What It Does (via Github Actions using a local Claude Skill)

 

  - Pulls tasks from ClickUp (Sprint lists with "Next Release" or "Closed" status)
  - Analyzes the worksuite-pwa codebase for implementation details
  - Updates documentation files in the worksuite-pwa-documentation repo
  - Commits changes directly to main

 

  Runs automatically every Monday at 4am EST (9am UTC)

 

  To Manually Trigger

 

  1. Go to https://github.com/AdvGrower/worksuite-pwa-documentation/actions
  2. Click "Update Mintlify Docs"
  3. Click "Run workflow"
  4. Optionally enter a sprint number, or leave blank for latest

 

  Key Files

 

  | File                                    | Purpose                       |
  |-----------------------------------------|-------------------------------|
  | .github/workflows/update-docs.yml       | GitHub Action workflow        |
  | .claude/skills/mintlify-docs-updater.md | Skill instructions for Claude |

 

  Required Secrets (GitHub → Settings → Secrets)

 

  | Secret            | Purpose                  |
  |-------------------|--------------------------|
  | ANTHROPIC_API_KEY | Claude API access        |
  | CLICKUP_API_TOKEN | ClickUp API access       |
  | AZURE_DEVOPS_PAT  | Clone worksuite-pwa repo |
  | GH_PAT            | Push commits to GitHub   |

 

  Troubleshooting

 

  - "Credit balance too low" → Add credits (kennedys account or add your own in Github Secrets) at https://console.anthropic.com/settings/billing
  - ClickUp 401 error → Regenerate token in ClickUp (Settings → Apps → API Token)
  - Git push fails → Check GH_PAT has "Contents: Read and write" permission
  - No changes detected → Documentation may already be up to date

 

 

  View run history and logs at:
  https://github.com/AdvGrower/worksuite-pwa-documentation/actions/workflows/update-docs.yml

for anyone who get's tired of clicking ok to let claude go to the web 

 

> can i give you permission to go to the web without my ok?

 

● Yes! You can configure Claude Code to allow web tools without prompting. Here are your options:

 

  Quick way (this session):
  Use the /allowed-tools command to add permissions:
  /allowed-tools add WebFetch
  /allowed-tools add WebSearch

 

  Permanent way (all sessions):
  Add to your settings file at ~/.claude/settings.json:
  {
    "permissions": {
      "allow": [
        "WebFetch",
        "WebSearch"
      ]
    }
  }

 

  Or for specific domains only:
  {
    "permissions": {
      "allow": [
        "WebFetch(domain:*)",
        "WebSearch"
      ]
    }
  }

 

  Note: WebSearch is already in your allowed tools list, so that one won't prompt you. For WebFetch, you currently have specific domains allowed (like github.com, docs.ramp.com, etc.).

 

  Would you like me to help you add blanket WebFetch permission, or would you prefer to add specific domains as needed?

 

> yeah add WebFetch for all domains

 

● Read(.claude/settings.json)
  ⎿  Read 14 lines

 

● Update(.claude/settings.json)
  ⎿  Added 3 lines
      1  {
      2 +  "permissions": {
      3 +    "allow": ["WebFetch"]
      4 +  },
      5    "enabledPlugins": {
      6      "supabase@claude-plugins-official": true,
      7      "csharp-lsp@claude-plugins-official": true,

 

● Done. Added WebFetch permission for all domains to your settings. I can now fetch any URL without prompting you.

The dailyRateOfSale calculation ignores the DOW%, and that is applied at the Sell Down, which is downstream, and at the point of when the dayOfWeek would not be accessible. Would you like me to attempt to recreate this tree and send you updates?
We should meet.

Not Really - there are some bits and pieces documents.  We stopped sending out 3 Ring Binders of Printed Docs a long time ago.  We realized everyone does things a bit different - some are simple their Chart of Accounts is 10 Accounts others breakdown accounts by 1,2,3 or more sub accounts and have a chart of accounts by 100+ accounts.  Its all about consulting with the client and making sure we get it set for what they want to happen.  All this rolls from Inventory and Customers to the AR Orders, Payments, Credits and Interest.  Those hold the GL Accounts and are Posted to the GL.  Then there is the Inventory "Matrix" which groups like items depending how you set it up to pull GL Accounts out of Inventory.

It is part of the On-Boarding process of Growpoint to listen to what they want and need then make it work.
Is there any documentation on this?

That is a small and huge question.  Probably be a good conversation to have with Jon and I when he returns from the show next week.  The short of it, everything from AR - Sales Orders, Payments, Credits, Interest post to the GL.  The Sales order can pull GL Accounts from Inventory, Locations, Customers or a Default set of GL Accounts depending on the Customer/Item Hierarchy.  All those go to GL Posting.

Jon, Brian Strahan, can you get me a detailed list of all the functionality in Growpoint accounting? I'm working on a comprehensive doc explaining what Fulfill will do, and what it won't do for accounting, and would like to set up a comparison with current functionality in GP accounting.

reapply recipes is supposed to address that. Now, there has to be a recipe that has changes for produce to grab; it looks like she made some edits to her recipes after importing, and now there is no matching recipe for a lot of those lots. That's the main issue.

She is trying to fix some incorrect Recipe information and it is only letting her change Material Events when she tries to Reapply Recipes.  Is the Reapply Recipe on the Schedule suppose to reach down and grab up all changes done on a Recipe or just Events?

If that is true then the only way to fix a bad schedule is Archive and Reimport correct?

Hey Brian - quick update on the Reapply Recipes issue:

I've been testing this and haven't been able to recreate the error. I've successfully reapplied recipes for various scenarios - updating Plants Per Pot, Grow Weeks, etc. - all without issues.

Could you reach out to Christina and get specific steps to recreate the problem? Knowing exactly what she was doing when the error occurred would help us narrow this down.

We're still investigating the missing Plants Per Pot issue. Our current theory is that when CMG hit that error, it cleared the PlantsPerPot visually on the front end, but it may still be represented correctly on the backend/database.

Once Brad gives us access to the repo, we'll dive into the code to see what's happening under the hood.

-Nathan's AI Servant

Chris 

I'm working on guided product tours that can span multiple pages (ex: setup your first customer, then take location tour). Worked with claude and below is the suggested approach, any concerns?

 

  How it works:
  - Add event tracking to key user actions (e.g., creating their first customer)
  - Configure Product Tours in Intercom's dashboard that trigger based on these events
  - Intercom handles showing tours only once per user

 

  Example implementation:


 

 

  const handleSubmit = async (formData) => {
    try {
      await saveCustomer(formData);



      // Track event for Intercom Product Tours
      (window as any).Intercom?.('trackEvent', 'customer-created');
    } catch (error) {
      // handle error
    }
  };

 

 

  Technical impact:
  - Intercom is already integrated in the app - no new dependencies
  - Minimal code changes - just adding trackEvent calls at key points
  - Tour content is managed entirely in Intercom's dashboard (no code deploys to update tour messaging)

 

  Benefit:
  - Contextual guidance at the right moment in the user's workflow
  - Reduced support burden for common "getting started" questions
  - Easy to iterate on tour content without developer involvement
